{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3126451,"name":"Kai Sugrue","username":"KaiFrc","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kaifrc/{size}/197150_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-14T23:25:10.728Z","cooked":"

HI,

I was replicating the weed wacker indexer/intake that ausTIN CANS had begun prototyping this year. They had mentioned that the weed wackers would have trouble orienting the cone because it wasn’t getting enough “spinny hits” on the cone the drivetrain chassis was moving.

I had thought of potentially using a ramp attached to the intake that would make the game piece move relative to the robot’s speed, therefore allowing the weed wackers to index the gamepiece.

This image is obviously not up to scale, but this is what I sort of envision, likely a smaller ramp too:

I wanna play around with some of the geometry associated with making an intake with a ramp on it, I know 254 have done something like it in the past to guide game pieces in compliance with their bumpers.

Another solution is that I can just make a wheeled intake + just weed wack it once it’s already within the robot rather than on the intake. I don’t exactly know how much more space it’d take up though. Maybe I just want it to be as compact as possible ¯_(ツ)_/¯.

In any case, I want to know if any team has done an intake with a ramp in the past and see their version of it. Thanks!

Cheers,
Kai

Funny enough we were messing around with this idea a bit today during prototyping, actuation isn’t in the prototype, but a four bar would likely work just fine
